intro: Apinagia capillacea, commonly known as the slender apinagia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high elevations where conditions are cool and moist. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Apinagia capillacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
